question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Context from Politico:

A number of House Democrats are coordinating to express their opposition to their party’s attempt to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, claiming it suppresses the crucial ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in this initiative.

A letter in draft form, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, serves as the initial public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many within their ranks are quite concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

This market will be resolved as YES if a public statement opposing the accelerated nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 Democratic House members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the strategy to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a response against their party’s initiative to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they believe suppresses the vital ongoing discussions regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted and circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO signifies the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still quite concerned about Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a smart approach to stifle debate and, by sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to confirm the letter’s existence.

This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who identify with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, multiple letters with a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers would also suffice for this market to resolve to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

para_P.title: Was there an intentional shooting aimed at Trump on July 13th?
para_P.body:
According to the NYT: "It sounded like what could have been gunfire that interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was quickly taken off the stage and seemed to have a wound near his ear."

This will be marked as YES if an individual deliberately fired a bullet or a similar projectile at Trump on July 13th. It will be marked as NO if an accidental discharge or a ricochet resulted in something being directed towards Trump.

*The term bullet-like projectile is used here to refer to any object that acts like a bullet in terms of lethality, even if it doesn't meet the strict definition of a bullet. For example, a BB gun pellet would not be considered, as it is not likely to be lethal like a bullet.

para_P.body:

This would be considered YES if a person intentionally discharged a bullet or a comparable projectile at Trump on July 13th. It would be NO if the event resulted from an accidental firing or a ricochet that sent something towards Trump.

*The phrase bullet-like projectile encompasses any object that operates similarly to a bullet, even if it is not officially categorized as one. For example, a BB gun pellet would not qualify, as it lacks the lethality of a bullet.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 60%? (i.e. "Fresh")
question.body:
"Trap" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 60% or higher, one week after release (August 9th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, here are the equivalent RT scores for some recent M. Night Shyamalan films:

"Knock at the Cabin": 67%

"Old": 50%

"Glass": 37%

The "Fresh" designation in the title is just used for illustrative purposes, it won't resolve the market (AFAIK, movies >=60% are "Fresh", but there may be other restrictions).

Currently, the close date is set for resolution. If there's sufficient interest & a clear review embargo date is set, I might upgrade this to "Plus" and set the close date to be the review embargo—so perhaps don't bet if you're concerned that the close date might shift up.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will there be a red card in either semi-final of UEFA Euros 2024?
question.body:
Will a red card be shown to any player or member of support team in either of the UEFA Euros 2024 semi-final games?

A red card is shown either for serious fouls/misconduct, or as the result of a player receiving two 'warning' yellow cards. 

The market will resolve YES if any member of any of the teams playing the semi-finals is shown a red card and sent off the pitch.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be determined to be incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
The answer is YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances does not apply. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
The response is YES if the Vice President, together with a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable authority), activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President cannot perform the duties and obligations of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar events is not considered. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not relevant.

Context: A GOP legislator urges Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered TRUE if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is not relevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Background: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the Presidency.

para_P.title: Will Biden be considered unfit according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This will be regarded as TRUE if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is incapable of executing the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not part of this consideration. Additionally, Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

Context: A Republican legislator has urged Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the Presidency.

para_P.title: Will Biden be considered unsuitable under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This will be regarded as TRUE if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to carry out the powers and duties of his office" and allow the Vice President to assume the role of President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not part of this consideration. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

Context: A Republican lawmaker has urged Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the Presidency.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unfit according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered TRUE if the Vice President, alongside a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority), activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and permits the Vice President to take over the position of President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is not relevant to this inquiry.

Biden's exit from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included in this evaluation. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not taken into account.

Context: A Republican official has called on Merrick Garland to use the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the Presidency.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump competes against Joe Biden instead of a standard Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold surveys are available, both concluding on July 6. One survey prompts Manifold participants to cast their vote alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other invites them to vote alongside a standard Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error rate, yet every other Democrat considered in these hypothetical scenarios either leads or stays within the error margin. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will confirm a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The answer will be YES if the result of this calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is at least 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the specified closing time, regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21?
question.body:
Clone of (and resolves identically to) https://polymarket.com/event/stranded-astronauts-depart-on-boeing-starliner-by-july-21?tid=1719805056151

The Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, must depart within 45 days due to the Harmony module's limited fuel.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. 

The Starliner will be considered to have departed if it has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth.

The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

question.title: Will there be any break between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41?
question.body:
A break can be any amount of time, enough for Shonen Jump to state at the end of chapters if there will be a break before the next one.

“YES” = “Yes, there will be a break after chapter 40”

“NO” = “No, there will not be a break after chapter 40”

Plan to close this on official release, will close earlier if known-accurate leakers post any details about a break ahead of time. I do not vote in my own questions.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new version of Peoplemover for Disneyland at D23 2024?
question.body:
This will resolve YES if Disney announces that they are working on a new version of the Peoplemover at D23 in the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

To be considered a new version of the Peoplemover, this attraction would need to be a ride that has portions with views above Tomorrowland AND has at least two of the following characteristics:

1) includes "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in the name

2) uses existing Peoplemover track structure for a portion of the ride

3) rebuilds portions of the Peoplemover track on the same alignment for the new ride

4) has a station in the old peoplemover station building

5) rebuilds the old peoplemover station with approximately similar characteristics and location 

This can resolve to YES if a new ride was announced that uses portions of the Peoplemover track and station as a part of an Incredibles ride, but would resolve to NO if an attraction called Peoplemover was announced that took place entirely inside of a show building, offering no aerial views of Tomorrowland.

1) includes "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in the name
2) uses existing Peoplemover track structure for a portion of the ride
3) rebuilds portions of the Peoplemover track on the same alignment for the new ride
4) has a station in the old peoplemover station building
5) rebuilds the old peoplemover station with approximately similar characteristics and location

This can resolve to YES if a new ride was announced that uses portions of the Peoplemover track and station as a part of an Incredibles ride, but would resolve to NO if an attraction called Peoplemover was announced that took place entirely inside of a show building, offering no aerial views of Tomorrowland.

para_P.title: Is Disney set to reveal a revamped version of the Peoplemover for Disneyland during D23 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be marked as YES if Disney discloses that they are developing a revamped version of the Peoplemover at the D23 Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

For it to qualify as a revamped version of the Peoplemover, this attraction must be a ride that features sections with views over Tomorrowland AND must possess at least two of the following traits:

1) includes "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in its title

2) utilizes existing Peoplemover track structure for part of the ride

3) reconstructs segments of the Peoplemover track on the same route for the new ride

4) has a station located in the previous Peoplemover station building

5) reconstructs the old Peoplemover station with roughly similar features and position.

This can be marked as YES if a new ride was announced that incorporates segments of the Peoplemover track and station as part of an Incredibles ride, but will be marked as NO if an attraction named Peoplemover was announced that occurs entirely within a show building, providing no elevated views of Tomorrowland.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Disney will reveal a revamped version of Peoplemover for Disneyland during D23 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be determined as YES if Disney discloses their plans for a revamped Peoplemover at D23 during the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

For it to qualify as a revamped version of the Peoplemover, the attraction must be a ride featuring sections with views over Tomorrowland AND must possess at least two of the following traits:

1) contains "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in its title

2) utilizes part of the existing Peoplemover track structure in the ride

3) reconstructs segments of the Peoplemover track along the same path for the new attraction

4) includes a station within the former Peoplemover station building

5) renovates the old Peoplemover station with roughly similar attributes and positioning.

This can be marked as YES if a new attraction was revealed that incorporates segments of the Peoplemover track and station as part of an Incredibles-themed ride, but will be marked as NO if a ride named Peoplemover is announced that occurs entirely within a show building, providing no elevated views of Tomorrowland.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Disney will announce a redesigned version of Peoplemover for Disneyland at D23 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be marked as YES if Disney reveals their intentions for a redesigned Peoplemover during the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

To be considered a redesigned version of the Peoplemover, the attraction must be a ride that features sections with views of Tomorrowland AND must include at least two of the following characteristics:

1) has "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in its name

2) makes use of part of the existing Peoplemover track structure in the attraction

3) rebuilds sections of the Peoplemover track along the same route for the new ride

4) features a station within the previous Peoplemover station building

5) updates the old Peoplemover station with roughly similar characteristics and location.

This can be marked as YES if a new attraction is announced that integrates segments of the Peoplemover track and station as part of an Incredibles-themed ride, but will be marked as NO if a ride titled Peoplemover is revealed that takes place entirely within a show building, offering no elevated views of Tomorrowland.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Disney will reveal a revamped version of the Peoplemover for Disneyland during D23 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if Disney discloses their plans for a revamped Peoplemover at the D23 event in the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

For it to qualify as a revamped version of the Peoplemover, this attraction must be a ride that features sections with views over Tomorrowland AND includes at least two of the following criteria:

1) has "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in its title

2) utilizes part of the existing Peoplemover track structure for the ride

3) reconstructs segments of the Peoplemover track along the same route for the new attraction

4) includes a station within the former Peoplemover station building

5) refurbishes the old Peoplemover station with roughly the same characteristics and location.

This can be marked as YES if a new ride is announced that incorporates elements of the Peoplemover track and station as part of an Incredibles-themed ride, but will be marked as NO if an attraction named Peoplemover is announced that occurs entirely within a show building, providing no elevated views of Tomorrowland.
